description: collect tiles and form patterns to decorate the walls of the palace of Portuguese king Manuel I.

e1.title: Crystal mosaic (2020)
e1.description: includes 2 extra boards, I made a PnP version.

e2.title: Special factories (2022)
e2.description: all factories from Azul Chocolatier version, I made a PnP.

description: incident response cards, from Black Hills Information Security and Active Countermeasures. Contains 52 unique cards to conduct IR tabletop exercises and learn attack tactics, tools and methods.

bet on five racing camels, trying to suss out which ones will place first and second in a quick race around a pyramid. The earlier you place your bet, the more you can win — should you guess correctly, of course.

e1.title: Crazy camels (2018)
e1.description: 1 black camel, 1 white camel that run in the opposite direction to create entropy.

e2.title: The referee camel (2017)
e2.description: The fact that the camels in Camel Race pile up and run on together is a thorn in the side of the race organizers and is now to be prevented with the help of a referee camel The game is played as usual and supplemented by the brown referee camel. At the beginning of each stage, the player sitting to the right of the stage starter may place the referee camel on any free space on the track. If a camel unit ends its movement on the referee camel's space, all camels in this unit are asked to “unstack” and line up next to each other on this space. The camels are “unstacked” from top to bottom and lined up in the same order from left to right. (The top camel is therefore on the far left, at the outer edge of the playing field, and is considered to be the furthest forward). As soon as the camels have been “unstacked” (or a single camel has landed on the field), the referee camel is removed from the track and placed next to the game board. It is not used again until the start of the next stage. If a camel unit lands on a field of camels that have already been unstacked, it jumps onto the camel furthest to the left.

description: play as sleepyhead OR as the thief trying to steal the cheese. No moderator, no player elimination, no set pattern: it uses die-face combinations to provide replayable scenarios.
strategically mix colors together to achieve victory. Refill, print or mix your cards and pick from the central market.

mechanics: area majority, abstract thinking, dice (no rolling)
description: fast-paced abstract dice game for two players, where no die is rolled. You just need the instructions and 2 sets of 6 D6 dice in different colors.

mechanics: bid, race, collect, bluffing, deduction, maze, puzzle, bidding, open drafting, set collection
description: five small games with 5 different mechanics. Beautiful art inspired on the classic short story The Lady or the Tiger

mechanics: hand management, open drafting, set collection
description: herd dragons and cast magic spells to boost their value.

a solo sketching and drawing game. You ingress in a quarantine corrupt zone to document strange plants. Inspired by H.P. Lovecraft's book: The Colour Out of Space and Jeff Vandermeer's trilogy: Annihilation.

game: A fake artist goes to NY
description: players go around the table twice, drawing one contiguous stroke each on a paper to draw the word established by the Question Master, then guess who the fake artist is.
PnP, multiplayer with N copies of the game. 18 cards show different types of woodland areas. Harvest as much blackberries, chestnuts and mushrooms, using the dice as counters.
PnP, multiplayer with N copies of the game. 18 cards feature orange, lemon and lime trees and a new element, glades. Increase your harvest as much as you can.

e1.title: Groove wars (2023)
e1.description: A fan-made two-player competitive version of Grove. https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/253688/grove-wars-a-2-player-game-of-fruitition-fan-game

game: El crimen de Quintana de la Matanza
description: a mysterious death at a folk festival causes trouble. The death was dismissed by the police as natural and you are commissioned by an unknown person to investigate the case more closely. But who is the unknown client? And is it really a natural death?

strategic game for two players that is not restricted by a board and can be played anywhere on any flat surface. The base game of Hive is made up of twenty two pieces, eleven black and eleven white, resembling a variety of insects.

e1.title: Mosquito (2007)
e1.description: During the game, they are placed in the same way as the other pieces. Once in play, the Mosquito takes on the movement characteristics of any creature it touches at the time, thus changing its characteristics throughout the game.

e2.title: Ladybug (2010)
e2.description: The ladybug moves exactly three spaces each turn: two spaces up onto the hive and one space down off the hive.

e3.title: Pillbug (2013)
e3.description: 2 new black/white pieces. The pillbug can move one space at a time OR it can move an adjacent unstacked piece (friend or enemy) two spaces: up onto the pillbug itself, then down into another empty space adjacent to itself.

mechanics: area majority, end-game bonus, set collection, worker placement
description: over 6 rounds, the players move wooden stones by boat to create 5 seminal monuments. On a turn, a player chooses 1 of 4 actions: procure new stones, load stones on a boat, bring a boat to a monument, or play an action card.

e1.title: Private ships (2016)
e1.description: adds 4 ship tokens. Once per game, a player may take 1 stone from their supply, place it on their private ship and sail the ship: all this is 1 action.

e2.title: The Stonemason's Wager (2016)
e2.description: bet on which monument will be the grandest at the end of the game! If you are correct, you get bonus points.

e3.title: The Pharaoh's Favors (2017)
e3.description: on your turn, instead of taking any other action, you may perform a special action listed on the card.

e4.title: The Sun Ship Tiles (2019)
e4.description: whenever a player places a stone on a Sun Ship token, they may immediately take the associated action for that Sun Ship token. The placed stone remains on this space in either case.

description: solo-first hexcrawling adventure game. Set in a solarpunk future, a century from now, you play a character whose brother is killed by a robot. The next day, you pack your bag with a few supplies and foolishly head off into the uncharted wilderness to go kill the God responsible.

mechanics: dice rolling, cards, bluffing, take that
description: go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

mechanics: cooperative, pattern recognition, deduction, abstract thinking
description: in this cooperative stand-alone game, the ghost sends visions with illustrated cards. The psychics try to interpret them in order to rule out certain suspects and locations.
PnP, multiplayer with N copies of the game. Card overlpping game. Harvest fruit (score points) by playing cards so that their fruit trees overlap other trees already that bear the same fruit.

e1.title: Orchard Recipes (2023)
e1.description: 14 cards that feature recipe challenges that provide a win/lose condition as an alternative to beat your own score.

e2.title: More Orchard Recipes (2025)
e2.description: 4 cards that feature recipe challenges for a win/lose condition.

description: make connections between clues. Work together to fill in the grid of code words by giving single word clues that represent the crossing of two different code words in the grid.
draft ingredients and mark them on score sheet; combine the ingredients to craft a potion and mark it on the potion chart. The game ends when someone earns their 3rd Star.

e1.title: Poison Pack (2023)
e1.description: adds a new deck of poison cards, whenever you mark a Poison skull, gain a Poison card. You may take either of the two revealed cards or the top card off the deck.

mechanics: drafting, set collection, pattern recognition, take that
description: take an ingredient marble from the dispenser and watch the others fall. If you connect marbles of the same color, they explode and you can take them, too! Complete your potions using the marbles you collect, and drink them to unleash their magical power.

connect as many exits on your board as possible. Each round, a set of dice are rolled in the middle of the table, determining which kind of road and railway routes are available to all players. You have to draw these routes on your erasable boards to create transport lines and connect your exits, trying to optimize the available symbols better than your opponents.
each player fills out a category list with answers that begin with the same letter. If no other player matches your answers, you score points.

players buy and sell real estate. During the game's two distinct phases, players first bid for several buildings then, after all buildings have been bought, sell the buildings for the greatest profit possible.

e1.title: Asesores (2021)
e1.description: adds a 3rd phase to the classic game, with players starting the game by bidding to hire advisors who will then assist in the second and third phases of the game when players acquire houses, then sell them.

description: PnP, dramatic game of political intrigue and betrayal set in 1930s Germany. Each player is randomly and secretly assigned to be a liberal or a fascist, and one player is Secret Hitler. The fascists coordinate to sow distrust and install their cold-blooded leader; the liberals must find and stop the Secret Hitler before it's too late. The liberal team always has a majority.

mechanics: pattern recognition, pattern building, spacial thinking
description: race to rearrange sticks to match the patterns shown on cards, and whoever collects the most cards wins!
quiz game where a player doesn't need to wait for one's turn for long. There are ten possible answers to each question, and every player gets to answer every question.
take Gem and Pearl tokens from the common board, then purchase cards, gather bonuses, royal favors, and prestige.

mechanics: push your luck, dice rolling, race, set collection
description: place dice onto dog cards. Dice you can't place get buried in your yard. Bury too many dice and you bust. Complete 6 dogs and you win!

mechanics: deck building, hand management, open drafting, take that
description: deckbuilding game in the Star Realms series which is both a standalone box set for two players (featuring an 80-card trade deck, as in the original) and an expansion for the base Star Realms set that allows it to be played as a four-player game.
can you build your campfire as the storm increases in intensity or will the rain get the better of you? Components: 8 Storm cards; 12 Rain cubes; 1 Storm Tracker in rulebook.

mechanics: cards, hand management, set collection, take that
description: players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points.
open sea adventure and exploration. Each player is the captain of a vessel sailing the seas and requires a single printed game sheet and pencil, while one player also needs to provide three dice.

is a classic dice game played with 5 dice. Each player's turn consists of rolling the dice up to 3 times in hope of making 1 of 13 categories. Examples of categories are 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, straight, full house, etc.
